content.description:
Indivisible climbs a convex arete on perfect sandstone over a good landing.

Sit start with a left hand sidepull edge and a right hand palming the arete. From there, reach a right hand sloper, set the left heel hook, bump up through a pair of left hand sidepulls, reach and match on the better hold above, bring the feet onto the face, continue to the edges below the lip, then gain the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The immediate landing is great, but there a rock behind the problem (it was never an issue during my experience though).
content.location: It climbs the blunt west facing arete of Stegosaurus.

content.description: Sit start with left hand three-finger pocket and a low right hand edge. From there, stick a tough right hand edge, follow to the better edges above, position on the pinch, bring the feet up, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the center of Stegosaurus' west face.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edges. Paste a foot, gain a great right foot edge,move to a horizontal edge seam, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: The immediate landing is great, but there are rocks just outside of it. Bring a pad or two.
content.location: It climbs the northwest slab of Stegosaurus.
